info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:03PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN FAIRFIELD AND NORTHERN WESTCHESTER COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Kisco, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stamford, Norwalk, Ossining, New Canaan, Mount Kisco, Greenwich, Westport, Ridgefield, Darien, Wilton, Weston, Hawthorne, Bedford, Yorktown Heights, and Croton-on-Hudson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
